titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the John Greig correspondence, 1846-1847
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, May 2019

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Principally the letters of Robert Wilson, a Liverpool merchant, discussing the grain trade, the Anglo-American dispute over Oregon, the Mexican War, and politics in England, mentioning Lord John Russell, Sir Robert Peel, and the repeal of the Corn Laws.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: John Greig correspondence, 1846-1847, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, May 2019.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Lawyer, banker, educator, and Congressman, from Canandaigua (Ontario Co.), N.Y.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Principally the letters of Robert Wilson, a Liverpool merchant, discussing the grain trade, the Anglo-American dispute over Oregon, the Mexican War, and politics in England, mentioning Lord John Russell, Sir Robert Peel, and the repeal of the Corn Laws.

controlaccess.subject: Corn laws (Great Britain)
Grain trade -- Great Britain
Merchants, British -- Political and social views
Oregon question
